general.headline: Lead HR Business Partner at Quantium
general.description:
I am a Lead HR Business Partner for Quantium, collaborating with our global leadership teams to build and deliver our people strategy. Understanding what motivates people, creating the best career experiences for our team and delivering world class products is what drives me. 

My success as a HR professional has been achieved through my ability to master the art of balancing being an advocate for the employees while ensuring the commercial objectives are achieved.

With 6 years industry experience across the full breadth of Human Resources capability. My experience and achievements span across leadership coaching & growth, strategic workforce planning, merger, industrial relations, systems implementation, culture & change management, reward and talent acquisition, managing offshore support team and general HR management. I am passionate about creating and driving talent solutions that transform the customer and employee experience to gain competitive advantage.

When I am asked about the value HR brings to an organisation, I am passionate that the value extends below the traditional policies, processes and good governance. It is enabling the commercial strategy of the business through creating an engaging high performing work force. 

Underpinning this operational experience, I have a Bachelor of Psychology, an MBA and am a certified Strength Profile practitioner. I was a winner of the HRD Rising Star award in 2018.

general.headline: Existential Philosopher - Philosophical inquiry, ethics, coaching and presentations.
general.description:
The question that drives my work is - How do you lead a meaningful and fulfilling life that contributes to the greater good? And that on your death bed allows you to look back with no regrets?

Many of us have good intentions but fail to translate these into reality. My work aims to bridge the gap between theory and reality and draws on research from the inter-disciplinary fields of existential philosophy, ethics, social psychology and neuro-cognitive science.

The primary question I ask is – How are you creating your reality? and the theoretical framework I use is existential (social constructivist) – where the key relationship is between being and time.

The aim is existential alignment between what you are trying to create, what you are habitually doing and the story that you are telling about what you have already created and what’s now possible.

Philosophical inquiry with individual and corporate clients is into Vision and Values – what are you trying to create? What Values will guide you? And how does this translate into actions? How can you create and lead ethical systems?

My coaching addresses the alignment question – are you habitually acting in alignment with your Vision? Are you telling a supportive story to yourself?

The presentations I deliver aim to challenge thing by showing alternative ways of viewing reality.

My current research explores “Why Good People Do Bad Things” and I welcome new opportunities to work with inspiring people and organisations on ethics and governance issues. For further discussions please contact me.

jobs.description: Felllowship for research into corporate governance and business ethics

The Programs incorporate the latest research from Neuroscience, Quantum Physics and Ontological Philosophy all with REAL world application. See the website for more info.

general.headline: CEO About my Brain Institute & Neuro-Learning Programs Associate at MGSM Executive Education
general.description:
Silvia's scientific background and curiosity about the human brain led her to a decade long journey of research into optimal brain functioning and the application of neuroscience in leadership and daily life. Her past and current roles have uniquely prepared her for the current undertaking, that of leadership activist & change agent.

Silvia Damiano founded The About my Brain Institute in 2009, with the purpose of democratising leadership & neuroscience. She has a passionately held belief, that leaders in our 21st century global economy and their organisations must radically change long-held ideas of what constitutes effective leadership

In her ground-breaking book ‘Leadership is Upside Down’ and the 2018 documentary ‘Make Me A Leader’, Silvia provides both compelling evidence and explores the importance of leadership in our personal and professional lives and what it takes to develop the human behind the leader.

Silvia has worked in different countries, across many industries, helping teams and organisations improve business performance. Silvia’s clients have described her as a passionate, dynamic, a highly experienced speaker and master facilitator on the topics of Emotional Intelligence, Cultural Change, Neuroleadership & Engagement.

Her specialities are:

• Neuroleadership
• Emotional Intelligence
• Leadership Development
• Employee Engagement

IOD provides a variety of organisational psychology services which include: 

Executive coaching – Assisting people professionally and personally articulate and reach their desired goals
Workplace investigations – Providing workable solutions to workplace issues 
Assisting individuals deal with and find solutions to depression, anxiety, stress, confidence, self-esteem, sleep issues, work-related problems, grief and loss, habits and phobias
All aspects of training including needs analysis, design, development and delivery
Conflict management and mediation
Critical incident debriefing and trauma counselling 
Employee assistance programs (EAP) 
Leadership development
Psychological testing and assessment 
Vocational assessment and career counselling 
Team development and facilitation


Shelley is interested in several key areas including:

Coaching executives, leaders and managers 
Investigating workplaces to help organisations resolve conflicts and understand their culture 
Assisting individuals understand and deal with their mental health issues so they can have a productive and well life


Professional skills:

Registered Psychologist with a particular focus on organisational psychology
Skilled in a variety of therapeutic techniques including Clinical Hypnosis Cognitive Behavioural Therapy, Interpersonal Therapy, life skills development, goal setting, counselling and personal coaching 
Several years’ experience in understanding the range of challenges within an organisation

general.description:
Alexandra Goodfellow is a Senior Client Partner based in Korn Ferry’s Sydney office, where she is part of the Board Services Practice and Co-Head of Financial Services for Australasia.

Ms Goodfellow has 25 years’ experience in executive search and consulting. She has lived and worked in Asia, Europe and Australia and has executed key mandates in other major global regions.

Having commenced her career in financial public relations in London, Ms Goodfellow entered the financial executive search industry in 1986 in London. In 1991, Ms Goodfellow established Fleming, Goodfellow & Stewart to provide executive search services for the Financial Services market in Australia. Subsequently, the firm extended its coverage to Asia Pacific.

In 1998, Fleming, Goodfellow & Stewart merged with a Hong Kong based firm and Ms Goodfellow relocated to Hong Kong as a principal and major shareholder of the firm, subsequently returning to work in London for a number of years.

Ms Goodfellow relocated back to Sydney in 2002 where she spent ten years leading the Australasian Financial Services practice for a top tier global executive search firm. Her diverse in-country experience and knowledge of global financial markets is highly regarded and she assists financial services institutions on a broad range of assignments including; investment banking, retail/commercial banking, private equity firms, assisting private equity with their acquisitions by placing both the board directors and executive committee, global markets, asset management and property.

Ms Goodfellow is Chairman of the Westmead Children’s Hospital Grace Ward and a member of the Tiffany Red Cross Committee. She has completed the Australian Institute of Company Directors Course and holds a Certificate of Registration REINSW.

Safe Work Australia leads the development of national policy to improve work health and safety and workers’ compensation arrangements across Australia. It is jointly funded by the Commonwealth, state and territory governments through an Intergovernmental Agreement.

As a national policy body Safe Work Australia does not regulate work health and safety laws. The Commonwealth, states and territories retain responsibility for regulating and enforcing work health and safety laws in their jurisdiction.

Safe Work Australia works to:
•	raise awareness of work health and safety as a key issue in the community
•	improve work health and safety, by understanding what influences Australian workplace cultures and then putting in place mechanisms to effect change
•	unify work health and safety laws throughout Australia
•	develop national work health and safety and workers’ compensation policy, and
•	identify opportunities for improvement in workers’ compensation arrangements.

general.headline: Deputy Chairman -Sydney Stock Exchange
general.description:
Sydney Stock Exchange (SSX) is a securities exchange in Australia with a market licence granted by the Australian Securities & Investments Commission (ASIC). SSX provides opportunities for growth oriented companies to raise the capital they need for expansion from a diversified range of domestic and international investors, especially from the Asia-Pacific region. SSX offers Chinese market participants an alternative listing venue to the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges in China.

SSX operates its official list of securities as a Main Board, but it has the flexibility that a Second Board provides as well. SSX will provide and develop specialised markets in a number of sectors, including Mining, Oil & Gas, Real Estate (REITs), Hi-tech, Agribusiness, Servicing and growth companies.

As a securities exchange, SSX provides ‘listing’ facilities to companies and securities issuers as well as 'trading' facilities for stock brokers, traders and investors to buy and sell shares/securities. The securities that can be traded on SSX include: shares issued by companies, units issued by trusts and other pooled investment products as well as fixed interest instruments, such as bonds.

SSX will act as a platform to bridge gaps, add value and benefit all relevant stakeholders. SSX aims to merge the best of both worlds: “East and West” and serve to fulfil our aspiration of “Bridging Asian and Australian Capital Markets”.

Fi has been described by CEO Magazine as The CEO's Secret Weapon and is acclaimed for championing female entrepreneurship empowerment. 

As an expert and pioneer in behavioural digital strategy and with over 24 years’ experience in the digital / tech sector over three continents, Europe, USA and Oceania; she has a depth of understanding that is unique globally.

general.headline: Mindful Leadership & Living Coach, Change Maker , Speaker
general.company: She Speaks - Global Mindful Leadership Development
general.description:
Aurora believes that there is a new era of consciousness emerging in the world of business, one that supports people and the planet equally to profit. One that sees a new way of leadership that recognises that who leaders are “being” rather than what they are “doing” is what creates long term sustainable results that benefit all.

This global paradigm shift happening in the world of business is moving from a pure profit & shareholder focus...to a purpose, people & all stakeholder focus. In essence this means that business is moving on from being only interested in making a profit to return to its shareholders. The new business paradigm holds the promise for business to deliver value toward a shared vision and purpose far beyond profit alone. One that creates value for all stakeholders, creating a better future for all. Doing better business, as a force for good and achieving exceptional results in the process.

With over twenty years in senior sales, partner management and management roles in the Telecommunications, IT and Wellness Services sectors, Aurora has been recognised with global and local business awards of excellence in companies such as BellSouth, IBM, Telstra and Optus.

Now as the founder of She Speaks and as a leadership coach, facilitator and presenter, it is Aurora’s passion to support leaders in their own self actualisation process to enable them to create more humanity in business through inspired self-aware leadership and allow for business to truly be a force for good. 

Aurora is one of the creators of the Self-Aware Leaders Program and is also a founding member of Conscious Capitalism and Humanity In business.

jobs.companyName: She Speaks - Global Mindful Leadership Development
jobs.jobTitle: Mindful Leadership & Living Coach, Facilitator, Speaker & Inspirational Changemaker
jobs.description:
She Speaks was created to support Leaders & Changemakers to create the new paradigm of business through Self- Aware Mindful Leadership Development.

This new paradigm of a business means a shift away from a profit only shareholder focus to a purpose, people, all stakeholder focus. As a result of this shift companies today face at least 3 new realities :-'

1. The pace of change in business is now too rapid to respond by using traditional thinking. Leaders can no longer 'manage change' but need to create their own future. 
2. There is now a level of transparency required in business like never before. People demand authenticity. 
3. There has been a shift in people away from acquisition to meaning. People want to interact with companies whose values they buy into.

These shifts have created the opportunity for a new paradigm of leadership. One that is Self -Aware, authentic, purposeful, and values based. She Speaks supports this shift by inspiring and developing leaders to lead in a new way, by offering a customised range of Emotional Intelligence and Self- Aware Leadership coaching and workshop initiatives.To enable this style of leadership, leaders must be willing to experience there own self actualisation process.

 A Self-Aware leader takes 100 % responsibility, lives on purpose, leads by inspiration, walks their talk, doesn’t ever compromise human values for material success, speaks their truth with honesty and respect, honors commitments impeccably, listens to others with humility, resolves disagreements attending to all concerns, accepts their emotions and expresses them constructively.

The Self-Aware Leaders coaching program Program awakens leadership through an inside out awareness approach to discover how leaders can outperform the market and become change agents for the greater good.

general.headline: Chairman & CEO at Grocon
general.description:
Daniel Grollo is Executive Chairman and CEO of Grocon, one of Australia’s largest private property investment, development and construction company.

Daniel is also a Non Executive Director of Blue Scope Steel, former Chair, and a founding member, of the Green Building Council of Australia. and a former national President of the Property Council of Australia.

In December, 2013 Daniel was one of 12 business leaders appointed to the Australian Prime Minister’s Business Advisory Council.

jobs.description: Daniel Grollo is Executive Chairman and sole owner of Grocon, Australia’s largest private property investment, development and construction company. Daniel became Executive Chairman in February 2014, having been Chief Executive Officer for the 14 years prior, as well as an Executive Director and member of the Grocon Board since 2000. In his role as Executive Chairman, Daniel continues to have strategic oversight of the business whilst also leading the company’s growth and diversification into new markets.

As CEO at Grocon, Daniel Grollo guided the strategic vision and undertakes planning
      and leadership in order to achieve the company’s objectives. Under Daniel’s direction,
      the company committed to sustainable building practice and received significant
      
      recognition and success for environmental achievements. In this role, Dani

... See more

As Executive Director of the Grocon Board, Daniel oversaw the overall management of
      the Board. This included managing financials, personnel, budgeting and ensuring
      compliance with legal obligations; public relations matters; and development of the
      
      Board. In this position, Daniel ensured the Board’s policies are implemente

... See more

Daniel Grollo is Non-Executive Director of BlueScope Steel and Chairman of the Health, Safety and Environment Committee, Member of the Nomination Committee and Member of the Remuneration and Organisation Committee, formerly a Member of the Audit & Risk Committee. As Non-Executive Director, Daniel provides objective expertise and guidance to the Executive and provides advice in matters relating to the organisation’s operations, strategy, structure and risk management. Daniel also assists in strategy development and ensures implementation is effective; that risk is adequately managed; and, monitors performance of the organisation and the executive management in terms of carrying out operations.

Daniel is the former Chairman and a Founding Board Member of the Green Building Council of Australia (GBCA) – a not-for-profit organisation established to promote the development of a sustainable property industry in Australia through the adoption and integration of green building technologies, design and operations.

Whilst Chair of the GBCA, Daniel ensured that Council members fulfilled their governance responsibilities; presided over the Council and meetings; guided Board Directors in relation to policy development in order to achieve and promote the Council’s objectives; acting as a spokesperson for GBCA; collaborating to ensure the budget is on track; and reported on the Board activities.

In his role as National & Victorian President of the Property Council of Australia – the leading advocacy group and champion for the Australian property industry and interests of those within it – Daniel implemented the Council’s vision, mission and strategic direction. In this role, Daniel also developed the strategic plan and directed and evaluated executives within the Council; oversaw operations in alignment with the Council’s strategic plan; and, represented the Council in activities and communication with key external stakeholders.

schools.description: As a Graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors – an organisation for company Directors that provides leadership and promotes excellence in governance in order to positively contribute to society and the economy – Daniel has completed the Institute’s Company Directors Course and fulfilled a number of criteria in regards to director duties, managerial experience and / or Advisory Board experience. Membership renewal for Graduate Members requires fulfilment of compulsory DPD (Director Professional Development) requirements.

general.headline: Chairman & CEO of GREEN WORLD CITY / Industry Leader / Keynote Speaker / Senior Advisor / VC
general.description:
Sein-Way Tan is well renowned in the fields of sustainable cities, innovation and future trends. He is the founder of Green World City, a consortium with global mission to make cities and large-scale projects more environmentally, socially and economically sustainable. He has been invited to meet many world leaders (Heads of State) and engaged with hundreds of influential political and business leaders worldwide.

He is an Australian business leader that have been invited to APEC Summit, Forbes Global CEO and many major international summits. He has also been invited by the Australian Government to do reports on Property Development, the Chinese Government to the Great Hall of the People and by major forums to advise on sustainable cities and future trends.

In addition to speaking on TV and radio globally, he has been invited to speak at the Nobel Peace Prize City Hall in Oslo, selected by leading experts and peers to be honoured as a World Cities Summit Leader and awarded by University of Newcastle for International Leadership.

He has lived and studied in Myanmar, Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong, Australia and Japan. This experience has given him a wide understanding of many cultures. He interest includes business, geopolitics, current affairs, history, languages, environment, innovation and evolving global trends.

He has also advised major corporations and CEO forums in Asia, Europe and North America on business opportunities in investing in large-scale sustainable projects and sustainable cities.

He is on the Advisory Board of Global Urban Development, Sustainia and Data Cities. He is an Advisor to many Governments, including the Chinese Government on creating green cities and is also on the Steering Committee of the UN-Habitat (United Nations) World Urban Campaign.

Sein-Way Tan is also passionate in helping innovative companies expand internationally by using his global connections and resources.

www.greenworldcity.com

general.headline: Career Planning & Progression ► Confidence ► Personal Brand ► Founder YPWA ► Speaker ► Mentor ► Facilitator
general.description:
Kate is one of Australia's leading experts on career, confidence and personal brand. Sought-after speaker mentor and facilitator Kate helps CEO’s, leaders and professional women achieve commercial, professional and personal success. 

Living her own passions and driving change ‘one woman at a time’, Kate is a mentor, helping female leaders (both experienced and emerging) get clarity about their careers, have the confidence to ask for what they want and position themselves for success. Known for her direct and honest approach, Kate pushes her clients to step out of their comfort zone, challenge the status quo and drive change for themselves and within their organisations.

Kate’s an active thought leader and advocate for gender equality and founder of Young Professional Women Australia – an organisation with a collective voice of more than 4,000 members committed to supporting the progression of professional women in their early-mid career. For over 5 years the organization has provided free advice, education and networking events as well as professional development programs that empower and inspire women to challenge the rules, ultimately becoming role models and change makers in their organizations. 

Quick facts about Kate:
	
●	20 years of corporate experience in consulting and leadership roles
●	Contributor to many leading publications including Womens Agenda, HR Daily, Smart Company, HRM Online, HR Monthly, Sydney Morning Herald, Marie Claire, BRW
●	12,000 LinkedIn followers read her unique and thought provoking content online
●	Panelist and speaker at various forums for Chartered Accountants Australia New Zealand, Australian Graduate Employers Association, Young Lawyers NSW, Women in Digital Leadership, Kaplan Education, IPAA NSW, Institute of Managers & Leaders (formerly AIM), CEO Institute & Women in Franchising.
●	Member & Chair (2017) NSW Regional Council, Institute of Chartered Accountants Australia (Qualified Chartered Accountant)

jobs.location: Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Gold Coast, Adelaide, Canberra & Regional Australia
jobs.description:
Young Professional Women Australia is an organisation that supports women in their early and mid career working within corporate Australia. More women are choosing to 'opt out' of the traditional corporate working environment, looking to consulting or small business as a better path to achieve their professional and personal goals. This 'leaky pipe' decreases the talent pipeline and success of gender diversity initiatives in both the public and private sector.

Our focus is empowering women through awareness and education and you can get involved as an individual looking to build her network and pursue professional development or as an organisation wanting to support women pursue career progression opportunities. 

► Build your network and attend one of our free networking events in Sydney and Melbourne
► Access coaching and mentoring through our Leadership Development and Mentor Program or Drive Your Career 
► Be inspired at our annual International Women's Day event 
► Develop skills and awareness in a range of one day workshops on Confidence, Personal Brand and Presentation Skills or
► Join our Linkedin community with over 4,000 like minded women who can help you achieve your career aspirations.

Thousands of women working in industries including finance, law, technology, construction, sales, education, retail, hospitality in organisations which include KPMG, Scentre Group, GPT, NBN, Telstra are part of the YPWA community.

If you are looking to get real about your career and life and want to be part of a community of like minded women working in corporate Australia call me on 0412 813 329 or email me via kate@ypwa.com.au

Core Confidence is a book written by Kate Boorer & Fiona Pearman. It examines the reasons (systemic, bias, practical and personal confidence barriers) that contribute to why professional women are often perceived as less confident than men. general.headline: We're Hiring! CEO and Co-founder at The Beanstalk Factory, Thought Leader, Director StartupAus. My first tech startup Qantas Postcards
general.description:
CEO of The Beanstalk Factory, Founding Director and Initial CEO of StartupAUS, Fishburners and ScribblePics

My focus at The Beanstalk Factory is on enabling individuals within corporates to improve their ability to innovate faster and with more confidence through training and coaching. We operate throughout Australia and work primarily with large ASX listed companies and government departments.

I have been an active contributor to the growth of Australia’s startup ecosystem for the past decade. In 2011, I became a Founding Director of Sydney’s first tech co-working space, Fishburners - a thriving, sustainable place for startups, speakers, mentors and corporates to collaborate with each other. Fishburners is currently home to more than 175 technology startups.

In 2014 I Co-Founded StartupAUS, Australia's national advocacy body for startups where I am currently Director and Chairman. Our focus at StartupAUS is working with government and industry to progress Australia's economic transformation through high-growth technology entrepreneurship. Australia has the passion and the drive but we need more founders, more tech-skills and a world-leading ecosystem to support them.

An Aussie startup founder myself, in 2008 I formed personalised postcard app, ScribblePics which operates www.qantas.com/postcards.

In 2015 I have teamed up with Jack Delosa, one of the leading advocates and voices for Entrepreneurship in Australia and Founder of the Entourage, Australia's leading education institution for entrepreneurs to create The Beanstalk Factory.

jobs.description:
Following one of my biggest passions in life, the Beanstalk Factory is helping more Australians to innovate. 

Our new initiative is focused on enabling individuals within corporates to improve their ability to innovate faster and with more confidence. 

I've teamed up with, Jack Delosa, one of the leading advocates and voices for Entrepreneurship in Australia and Founder of the Entourage, Australia's leading education institution for entrepreneurs. 

Everyone has heard of Jack and The Beanstalk, the fairy tale of how Jack and his family’s cash cow stops providing milk, Jack an early entrepreneur trades the cow for some magic beans which eventually result in a profitable business selling golden eggs and the hand in marriage of a beautiful princess.

Here at the Beanstalk Factory, we can see parallels between what Jack achieved and with modern business, in particular in terms of Corporate Disruption and Corporate Innovation.

It is the intention of every single business to bring in new revenue streams, while at the same time ensuring their current ones - their assets - are protected and grown. In today’s ever more competitive and challenging marketplace, everyone is scrambling around looking for those magic beans, anything that will give them that advantage, that step ahead.

That’s what we offer at the Beanstalk Factory. The help we provide our clients is not in the shape of magic beans or a golden egg laying goose, but rather tailored entrepreneurial coaching from serial entrepreneurs on how to use world leading innovation tools. 

We equip you and your team with a repeatable, structured discovery process, which not only enables you to find a problem worth solving, it then allows you to rapidly prototype and accelerate the solution. 

We may not promise you a princess at the end of it, but what we do guarantee is the fastest and most reliable way for your company to exceed its innovation objectives.

More at www.beanstalkfactory.com

general.headline: Futurologist | Author | Commentator | International Key Note Speaker | Industry 4.0 | Director | Board Director | Technology Advisory Board
general.description:
Rocky Scopelliti is a world-renowned futurologist. His pioneering research on the confluence of demographic change associated with Millennials, and digital technology, have influenced the way we think about our social, cultural, economic and technological future. His new book 'Youthquake 4.0 - A Whole Generation and the New Industrial Revolution' was launched in September 2018

As a media commentator, his unique insights have featured on SKY Business News, The Australian Financial Review, ABC Radio National, The Economist, Forbes and Bloomberg. As an international key note speaker, his presentations have captivated audiences across Asia Pacific, the USA and Europe including Mobile World Congress in Barcelona. As a thought-leader, over 150 boards and leadership teams, including Fortune 100 corporations, each year seek his advice on strategy. 

A distinguished author, his 13 thought leadership research publications have become internationally recognised for their influence including the World Economic Forum’s Disruptive Innovation in Financial Services Program.

In an executive capacity, he is a member of the Optus Business Leadership team as the Director, Centre for Industry 4.0 where he leads the specialist team creating world class thought-leadership and innovation to guide enterprises on the Fourth Industrial Revolution. 

In a non-executive capacity, he is a director on the board of Community First Credit Union, a member of the REST Super Technology Advisory Panel and the Australian Payments Council.

Educated in Australia and trained in the USA at Sydney and Stanford Universities respectively, he has a Graduate Diploma in Corporate Management and an MBA. He is also a graduate and member of the Australian Institute of Company Directors.

general.headline: Zileej Co-founder |  Inspired Innovation & Design
general.description:
Peter Gould is the Design Executive Officer at Zileej, an inspired innovation & design company headquartered in Dubai.  

He leads a global strategic creative team developing original brands, products and experiences that enable a more inclusive & representative future. Recent highlights include the Salam Sisters brand designed to empower & inspire young girls to dream big.    

In 2017 Peter's original design studio Gould Sydney was acquired by Zileej after 15 years successfully servicing clients such as Etihad Airways, Dubai Government and the United Nations.  

Peter’s personal spiritual journey has been a major influence on his creative work. His contribution in founding creative platforms, events, community initiatives and Islamic Economy startups has resulted in global recognition including a major award from the UAE Prime Minister. 

He has lectured Innovation & Design Thinking at UTS in Sydney and received the Stanford Certificate of Innovation & Entrepreneurship.  

Through design and creativity, Peter aims to inspire positive, imaginative thinking for a bright, shared future.

jobs.description:
Zileej is a truly diverse design & innovation team with a deep sense of shared purpose.

Our team is working passionately to design a brighter, more inclusive & representative future for everyone. 

We are currently developing a new generation of meaningful brands, products and creative experiences that serve the needs and aspirations of Muslim families around the globe. 

The Zileej creative team is also working with a range of innovation-focussed clients to improve their brands using our design-led thinking and strategic product development.

In 2017, Zileej acquired Peter's original design studio & team after 15 years of successful operation.

Delivering weekly lectures relating to Innovation, Design Thinking & Technology Management in the Faculty of Engineering & Information Technology (FEIT).     "UTS ranks 1st in Australia and 15th globally in the Times Higher Education top 150 universities under 50 years of age global rankings, a comprehensive system designed for young universities with indicators linked to industry innovation as well as academic excellence."

Acquired by Zileej in 2017.  

Peter reflecting on his original design consultancy: 

"15 years ago I was a young, ambitious design student looking for creative projects to kickstart my new freelancing graphic design business. Optimistic, naive perhaps, but certainly excited about the future.

It’s been an incredible journey in the years since, filled with challenges and success. I feel so blessed to lead a truly wonderful global creative team, with design projects and clients all over the planet. My team inspires me daily and our success is only possible because of their dedication, talent and passion.

Today I’m delighted to share that our team has been acquired into Zileej, a Dubai-based inspired innovation company that I helped co-found last year.

Our unified vision at Zileej is to inspire positive impact through design. We create brands, products, and experiences that enable a bright shared future for everyone, including Muslims.

We look forward to serving our current and future clients with meaningful, creative design work to grow their businesses and help new brands flourish. We continue to embrace Islamic Design Thinking as our strategic approach, now with an expanded team of 15 staff in 5 regions.

Bismillah! Together this new journey promises to bring many challenges, and inshAllah (God willing), success. I am so deeply grateful to everyone who has supported me so far, and in particular my wife who has patiently helped me on every step of the path."

general.description:
I am on a mission to create global change by harnessing and facilitating positive body
      image activism through the Body Image Movement and my feature documentary Embrace
      
      (2016).

jobs.description:
Body Image Movement is a movement to recognise and value real beauty from the
      inside out. Our role is to harness and facilitate positive body image activism, this
      includes encouraging people to be more accepting of who they are, to talk a positive
      body language (about their own bodies and others) and to prioritise their health before
      beauty.
      

    
      

    
      YOUR BODY IS NOT AN ORNAMENT, IT IS THE VEHICLE TO YOUR DREAMS

Developing Daughters/Supporting Sons is a seminar that responds to the demand for more information about how to raise girls and boys to have a positive body image and strong self-esteem. The seminar looks at the unrealistic body image messages as portrayed in the media for both men and women, and also addresses issues of how to assist in steering your child through the damaging messages they receive. 

Topics Include:

-Techniques for promoting healthy body image; toddlers to teens

-Understanding the impact of sexualisation of women and young girls in the media

-Developing media literacy for you and your children

-How to raise confident and empowered children

EMBRACE is a social impact feature documentary that I was inspired to make after posting an unconventional before and after photo that was seen over 100 million times. After receiving more than 7000 emails and messages from people all over the world, I realised that there was a global body-hating epidemic and felt compelled to find answers. 

EMBRACE is told from my point of view as I traverse the globe talking to experts, women in the street and well-known personalities about the alarming rates of body image issues that are seen in people of all body types. 

EMBRACE had its world premiere at the Sydney Film Festival 2016 and is due to be released in Australia & NZ from August 4th and in the United States from September 19th.

After starting the Body Image Movement and posting the before and after photo that
      was seen over 100 million times, I wrote 'Embrace: My Story from Body Loather to
      
      Body Lover', which went to Number 1 on Amazon across multiple platforms.

general.description:
I have 10 years of experience as a commercial litigator in complex corporate insolvencies and reorganizations involving Australian and multinational enterprises.

I regularly advise administrators, liquidators, receivers, banks, insolvent corporations and creditors on a wide range of insolvency administrations involving global corporations and government entities in a number of industries and sectors including banking and finance, retail, insurance, transport, media, energy, satellites, and property development.

Examples of my recent significant experience include acting for the Insurance Commission of Western Australia in the collapse of the Bell Group, one of Australia's largest and longest running corporate insolvencies, involving multijurisdictional disputes in relation to the distribution of $1.8 billion in the Bell Group liquidations. I also act for the receivers of NewSat in a claim against its CEO and chairman for breaches of duties relating to a satellite construction and launch project involving U.S.-based Lockheed Martin and French-based Arianespace.

I have in-house legal experience having been seconded to the National Australia Bank's disputes resolution team where I worked on matters that included the collapse of Storm Financial.

I have also been selected to complete the Insol International Global Insolvency Practice Course in 2018/2019.

I am an inaugural member of the Jones Day Pro-Bono Working Committee in Sydney and the founder of the Jones Day Young Professionals Sydney networking committee. I also sit on the committee of Australia's largest not-for-profit running organization, Sydney Striders Road Runners' Club Inc.

general.headline: Partner at Jones Day
I'll teach you everything you need to know about building & managing global teams that actually work.
general.description:
I was crazy enough to start a business in the GFC, opening a Brisbane executive recruitment & search business with co-founder Efren. We scaled the business nationally & then sold the brand in April 2017; so I understand how having the right people on board, the right process & plan is critical to continued businesses growth & success. 

When expanding the business, offshoring the administrative function to the Philippines was recommended. So, three years ago, we took the plunge & decided to offshore our back office to the Philippines, viewing this as the most cost-effective way to upscale our business while retaining control of our high-quality output & standard of service.

Originally, we were hesitant, & without the proper understanding of offshoring or support, we made a lot of mistakes - some obvious, some surprising - that cost us considerable time & money.  However, we learnt from our mistakes & built processes to make sure they didn’t happen again.

And then a surprising thing happened to us - our customers noticed what we were doing & asked us to help them with offshoring.  As most businesses in the competitive SMB market, they too were fighting to stay competitive, & saw offshoring as a way of staying in the game.  

At FiltaGlobal, we'll teach you everything you need to know about building and managing global teams that actually work.

We help small to medium sized companies in Australia & New Zealand, save on staffing costs without sacrificing work quality by finding, attracting, and keeping the best talent both in Australia and in the Philippines. We also work closely with our customers to help get the best out of their global teams and create environments where staff can thrive, no matter where on earth they are.

I’m also an active speaker on the topics of offshoring & recruitment & as a guest lecturer at QUT Business School.  I’ve been profiled in The Sydney Morning Herald, The Courier Mail & Quest newspapers & radio including 4BC, B105, Nova 106.9

general.headline: CEO of Seven West Media
general.description:
Tim is Chief Executive Officer of Seven West Media Limited. He is also a Director and Chairman of Australian News Channel, which operates Sky News, and a Director of Yahoo!7 and Free TV Australia.

Prior to his appointment as CEO of Seven West Media, Tim was CEO, Broadcast Television, and prior to that Director of Programming and Production for the Seven Network.

During his time as Director of Programming and Production, Tim was responsible for the creation and development of Seven’s digital channel strategy which was successfully executed with the establishment of 7TWO and 7mate, and also a major commitment to Australian programming, including the creation and launch of some of Australia’s biggest and most successful shows including Packed to the Rafters, My Kitchen Rules, The Force and Border Security.  

In April 2014, Tim received the MIP TV Médaille d'Honneur Award. This award recognises senior industry leaders who have made an exceptional contribution to the international television business and who, through their talent, leadership and passion, continue to drive the global TV industry forward.

As CEO of Seven West Media, Australia’s leading listed national multi-platform media business with annual turnover of $1.8 billion and a staff of 3000, Tim continues to oversee the television business of the Seven Network, the most profitable television network in Australia. In addition, he is also responsible for the company’s publishing businesses West Australian Newspapers and Pacific Magazines.  The West is the leading newspaper in Western Australia, and Pacific Magazines is one of Australia’s two biggest magazine publishing businesses with titles including Better Homes and Gardens, New Idea, WHO, marie claire and InStyle.  Also part of Tim’s brief is developing Seven’s increasing online and new media presence, including the company’s Yahoo7 joint venture with Yahoo, Inc. and the Presto SVOD joint venture with Foxtel.

general.headline: Chief Executive Group of Eight
general.description:
Vicki Thomson has worked in Australia’s university sector for 17 years championing its role as integral to the success of our nation and its people. She strongly believes that you don’t have to have gone to university to benefit from all that a university has to offer.  She is currently the Chief Executive of the Group of Eight Universities taking up the role in January 2015 and prior to this role she was Executive Director of the Australian Technology Network of Universities (ATN).  
Ms Thomson's diverse background covers print and electronic journalism, politics and issues management. She has an extensive media, political and policy background and was Chief of Staff to a South Australian Premier. 
She is a Board member of the European Australian Business Council, a member of the New Colombo Plan Reference Group and a former Board member of the Australia-China Council.
Ms Thomson has significant experience and relationships with China. From the mid 1990s when she was first involved through her Government positions, she assisted the management of trade, industry and energy negotiations over a number of years.  
She has been awarded  the prestigious Insignia of the Knights in the Ordre des Palmes Académiques  by the French Government  for her continuing services to the growth of successful education relationships and programs between France and Australia
She is also a member of MS Research Australia’s Leadership Council, a small national group of people intended to help keep MS Research Australia’s strategy contemporary and relevant.  This passion is driven by her own personal experience of having a sister with the debilitating disease.
She has extensive experience in building relationships between business, industry and universities, and supporting increased access to university for people from all backgrounds.  
In 2016 she was named in The Australian Newspaper’s Top 30 most influential people in Higher Education.
